Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: snooty_chat
Reviews.Content: Having read the mixed reviews of the Paddington Hotel we were unsure what to expect. Having stayed in this area of London before in a higher star hotel (four stars and mould on the windows!) I wasn't expecting much but was pleasently surprised. Ok so you have to check in over the road, hardly a hardship as it's not exactly a busy road to cross. What you should be mindful of though is the stairs! We were on the top floor and due to the hotel being a period property there was a lot of stairs! Not ideal if you've not got the best knees and heavy bags. After climbing the stairs we were surprised by the size of our room. There was ample room to swing a cat and a large one at that. The room was clean and had sufficient facilities. The fridge in the room was rather ancient and noisy and not really necessary but I could see that some visitors may appreciate it. Due to our room being at the top of the building it was also very warm, the heating wasn't on and we still had to sleep with the window open and it was only February! the room did have a floor fan and I can imagine it'll be well needed later on in the year. Breakfast was perfectly fine - you can't really go wrong with cereal and toast (and I happen to like Dairylea triangles on toast for breakfast), I do have to agree with the comments about the coffee though - having real coffee (not sachets) would be a vast improvement and would take little effort but would make a big difference! The Hotel is in an ideal location, well within easy walking distance of the tube and close to Hyde Park, there are also a couple of local supermarkets and restaurants nearby if you've exhausted yourself from walking around the sights all day. All in all the Paddington Hotel is a perfectly fine budget hotel and having stayed at the four star Hilton not so far away I know which one I'd return too - despite the sachet coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BLK82
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with another couple when we attended the Last Night of the Proms at Hyde Park, and were really disappointed - you had to book in at their sister hotel across the road, the rooms we adequate, although the bathroom felt dirty, and the TV only had analogue TV channels (in the wrong order). The attempt at breakfast in the basement was awful - coffee from sachets like you find in your room - a poor selection of "Continental" breakfast - not very fresh either. We will return to the proms again in 2012, but will AVOID this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “it's a perfect 2 stars hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: For our experience, i think the amount of negative reviews that we read here are unfair. Yes the rooms are on the building opposite to the reception, but it's the one shown in the pics anyway! The trick of the 70X number of the rooms has been clearly explained to us at the arrival so no inconvenience. There is no elevator, but the staircase are easy and wide. Our room, number 9, was much better than expected, for a 2 stars hotel: second floor, large, big window on the street side with light in the morning ( having sun coming in from the window in London is a plus!), bed was bit narrow for two but comfortable, small bathroom but equipped with all the necessary, small safe, fridge and tv good enough for 4 nights there! The location of the hotel is perfect: 100m from the underground on the Central Line, this means that with maximum one change you can get easily close to all the main attractions. The area is filled with hotels and has lots of residential streets, it's calm and pleasant, if you want to be in the middle of the "action" this is not the place to be. We found nice to go around and come back every day in a quiet area. Starting the day with a walk in Hyde Park, also 100m from the hotel, saying HI to the statue of Peter Pan, was really nice. We didn't try the included breakfast 'cause we preferred fresh food from bakeries or in one of the nice bars around the city. The staff was friendly and helpful. No doubts that when we will go back to London we will ask for Room 9 here!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here in May of 2011. The location is great, just minutes walk to Hyde Park which is amazing! Also right around the corner is Lancaster Gate Station, and a bus stop which will take you anywhere in the city that you want to go. Reception is just right across the street, and you have to drop off your key anytime you leave your room, but everyone at reception is very nice and helpful. Yes the rooms are small, and the bathroom is tiny, but that is to be expected. The rooms are comfortable enough for sleeping and showering. When you are in an amazing city like London with so much to see and do, you really only need a place to sleep and shower. That is what is great about The Paddington. It is no frills, but for the price and location it is perfect. They also include breakfast downstairs every morning. Nothing fancy but you get as much as you want. This place is great for travlers on a budget. The area is also very nice and quiet and we felt very safe. Even for two younger women alone in London we felt safe taking a walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at The Paddington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tone123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited London for the first time in September 2010. Since we had such a great time, we decided to go back this year as well (August 2011). On our first trip we stayed at The Paddington Hotel, and since we had no complaints what so ever, we simply booked The Paddington Hotel this time as well. We did not regret it. The staff is very friendly. The hotel standard is very basic. It's no luxurious hotel, but it's very decent. The rooms are tiny, but still sufficient. The bathrooms (at least both the bathrooms we've had) looks newly renovated. In the room you find a flatscreen TV with lots of channels, a refrigerator and a wardrobe. Basic, but sufficient for us who didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. As for the hotel's location, it could probably not have been better. The hotel is situated 2 min (by foot) from the tube station Lancaster Gate, as well as Hyde Park. Despite it's super central location, the hotel itself is situated in a really quiet street, so you will not be bothered by traffic etc. neither at day nor night. The hotel breakfast is basic yet sufficient and decent. There are toast, yoghurt, cheese, jam, honey, boiled eggs, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, milk and orange juice. Plain yet very tasty. We really enjoyed the breakfast. (One should notice that there is no elevator in the building and that the reception is located across the street.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mb25b
Reviews.Content: We were plesently surprised when we got to our room. The room itself was fairly big, but the bathroom was small. it was clean and the breakfast they supplied was also good. We found it easy to catch the underground to anywhere in the city. I would recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ADLex
Reviews.Content: Room #17 This is a great value for the money. I need a hotel to be clean, located in a safe neighborhood, and close to public transportation. This hotel rates highly on each count. Additionally the room was surprisingly spacious, with a comfortable bed, great water pressure in the shower, good breakfast and friendly staff. I would, however, list three downside items. The first two were clearly listed in their hotel description and were not a surprise but a downside none the less. 1. No elevator! There were 80 steps up to our room. It was manageable but worth mentioning anyhow. 2. Wireless Internet is only available in the lobby area which happens to be across the street. 3. The room needed a luggage rack. Also note that the hotel is not air conditioned. That concerned me coming from Central Kentucky in July, however, even on the top floor it was never an issue. The windows open and the evenings were always cool enough.

Reviews.Title: “CHEATING YOU! They Downgrade your room without compensation.”
Reviews.Author: EmilToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for 1 night NEVER again! I was downgraded without warning or compensation to a MUCH smaller room on the top floor with no washroom. I specifically called before booked to make sure that hotel have full washrooms. When I tried to complain they said there was a problem with my room and there is nothing else they can do about it. Also they argue that my room had a washroom?! It shad a sink!!!, but where do they expect me to sh…t? into the sink?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad -clean and Tidy and value for money”
Reviews.Author: brentb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paddington for one night before going to Istanbul and then 2 nights when we got back from Greece. Overall the hotel is pretty good.Location is excellent-5 minutes walk from Paddington Station and the Heathrow trains.Also close to some good eating places like the Pride of Paddington.Also close to buses to the Zoo and Camden Town. The first room was small but clean and comfortable but the second which was on the ground floor was much bigger and very nice.There is no lift but this did not present much of a problem. Rooms are cleaned every day.The only negative was that the curtains in the second room did not cover the windows enough and you had to do a bit of an adjustment to keep light out-but this was sorted and didn't detract too much. Breakfast was included--cereal,yoghurt,toast,coffee etc.It was basic but ok-enough to set you up for the day. Reception was over the road but this was not a problem-your luggage can be stored if room is not ready.Staff were ok and willing to give directions etc There are most probably better hotels but when you factor in location and price it wasn't too bad-certainly clean and comfortable. If I could I would rate this as good instead of average and would probably stay again

Reviews.Title: “Was ok as only staying 1 night!”
Reviews.Author: kellyv1987
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long morning travelling and after reaching Victoria we found out the nearest tube station, Lancaster Gate, was closed due to maintenance work. The hotel is about 3/4 mins walk from Lancaster gate tube station. The check in desk is over the road from the rooms in which we stayed so when we checked in and were told this, we were a bit surprised. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had room 10, key number 710 and there is only 1 word to describe the room and that is tiny and there is no exaggeration. The bed was alright, although the top throw over had holes and was fraying at the top edge. The tv in the room was working but very small, but seen as we were in london to shop that didnt really bother us. The bathroom was extremely small with barely enough room for us to move. The shower was powerful and had plenty of hot water which was nice. 1 big negative was the air vent in the window had dropped which meant we heard every bit of traffic that went past the hotel. This started at approx 6.30 am. would recommend this hotel if you dont mind being woke up by roaring cars early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel but tiny bedroom... although would go back.”
Reviews.Author: m_vieira_10
Reviews.Content: absolutely loved the hotel but me and my boyfriend had room number 10(key number 710) and it was so tiny! could very hot! also the tele was broken aswell, had a rubbish arial on it, but other then that i would definatily go back if i had another bigger room , and a tele that worked! i would recommend this hotel if you are staying for a couple of nights and are looking for a bargin, the breakfast was amazing to, loads to chose from.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a total pariah!!”
Reviews.Author: Lollypops400
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend has been out of work for a very long time & it took 6 months of saving for him to be able to afford this trip which he purchased for my birthday/valentines. I decided to book the hotel through a well known discount hotel booking website. we had a bit of trouble getting to London the first night as our local airport closed due to a crash & our flight was cancelled. I rang them & told them that we would be unable to arrive but I would pay for the night due to the short notice but would be there on the following day. I then booked a additional night over the phone. the hotel was fine, conveniently near paddington station, the room was clean, a bit on the small side but we didn't mind we were out all day & didn't arrive back until late every night. our problem was on the last evening, we arrived back to the hotel at 12:40am & my boyfriend went to collect the key from the reception across the road while I waited, he told me the reception staff wanted to speak to me. I went over & the man at the desk told me that I had to re-register back into the room because of the additional booking made over the phone, i told him that we had been here 4 days and no one had mentioned this to us & that the lady who checked us in first day told me our booking was fine & we had paid upfront for the days booked through the website, i even offered to pay the whole bill but she had told me that we could pay for the last night on checking out. But this man wouldnt let up, he told me that i would have to re-register and asked me to go to my room and get our passports numbers, it was now close to 1am in the morning, our room was across the street, up four flights of stairs & it was raining so i told him no, surely he would have them on record from our initial booking, then he told me me to ring my boyfriend to get the numbers, i again refused & said i would bring them in the morning. I had no sooner got back to the room when the phone rang & the man told me that i was to come over straight away & pay for the room. We explained to him that the lady said we didn't have to pay until check out, but he said if we didn't come over and pay we might be asked to vacate the room. so I had to AGAIN go over at 1am in the morning & pay. we were treated so badly... like thieves... I mean the fact we had offered with no quibble whatsoever to pay for the first night even though it was beyond our control that we couldnt arrive & our offer to pay in full our first day should of said we were honest and trustworthy. I have never felt so insulted! i am totally and utterly disgusted & to be honest it ruined what was up to that point a great holiday! avoid avoid avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: jesseliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, and had had a horrible experience at another hotel near by, so we were very pleased to find friendly staff, trendy and well appointed rooms. Reception is across the road, but that was not a problem and the were quite helpful. would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all. I would Stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Steve_In_Ulster
Reviews.Content: Great Location about 5 minutes from Paddington Station which is great if coming from Heathrow Airport. Roughly the Same to Lancaster Gate Station which I had to use as this time I was coming from Stanstead Airport Via Liverpool Street Station. I was given room number 718 which was on the top floor. The Room was comfortable. But very warm during the Summer time but it was no problem as they had a fan in the room and large windows that opened fully. The bed was Large comfortable. The bathroon was very small but that was not really an issue as I wasn't planning on living in there. The carpet did have a couple of stains from previous guests but there was nothing there to put me off staying there. The Pillows were comfy and the sheets cleaned every night. We had a hair dryer and there was Tea and coffee provided with a kettle and cups. There were complimentary toiletries but you would be better off using your own. The Recption was just across the street in the Royal court apartments. Staff were friendly and Helpful and Even though we had to Checkout of our room at 11 am Our FLight from London didn't leave until 7pm and they let us use their storage room frre of charge while we spent the final day sightseeing. They also have a small bar and Internet Usage there too. My only downside to the paddington hotel were the stairs which were not fun to have to climb over and over again but not a major hinderance to myself or my Girlfriend. But might be difficult for some Older guests or those who are less fit than others. The breakfast was basic, Various cereals, Toast with different spreads. Boiled Eggs, Croissants and fresh Orange juice. All in All I enjoyed my stay here. I really only used the Room to sleep in after a long days Adventuring around london. and on One occasion for a midafternoon Power Nap after going shopping around Camden market. Nice Hotel, Nice Staff, Perfect Location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Tiny and very hot warm room”
Reviews.Author: paulie25
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean beds, the room was very small and on the first night we could not sleep with the heat in the room,it was unbearable and there was no fan in the room, however we did request a fan the next day and got one for our second night, the breakfast was average , the pride of Paddington pub around the corner from the hotel serves excellent meals, best we had in London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but terrible brakfast and stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Sirenja Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: The best with the Paddington Hotel is the location, only five minutes walking from the tube. And that mattered a whole deal for us as we often arrived from the central city carrying a lots of stuff from shopping. And because of the hotels nearby location to the tube, we actually somethimes took the tube back to the hotel and dropped off our shopping bags, and then drove back to the city. The reception on the hotel is across the street, but that was no problem for us. Our first meeting with the staff was very positive, they were friendly and met us with a smile. I actually liked the room, and they looked better than you see in the photos. We got a room in fourth floor, a kind of corner room. Even if the room was small, expecially the bathroom, it felt ok. Our friend payed a little bit more and then got a huge room on the same floor...And that room really looked comfortable compared to ours. But I guess you get what you pay for, and we were only using the room for sleeping and refreshing. We sleept good, and didnt hear any noise from the streets, I actually found the streets wery quiet. A calm neighborhood! Of course, my opinion of a quiet street can be because we slept in the fourth floor. But as mutch as I liked the room I hated the stairs, and it was terrible going up all those stairs when we were tired an warned out after a whole day in the city. I have read other negative comments about the stairs, and belive me...they`re true! So if you dislike a lot getting tired in the legs going to your room, stay away from this hotel! The breakfast was also terrible, and its location in the basement was not cosy at all. We stayed at Paddington Hotel for 4 nights and I would defently stay there again, if I got a room in 1`st or 2`th floor.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE Paddington Hotel -- horrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: 3Islanders
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK this hotel. We had a prepaid booking for two nights, April 19 and 20, 2010. Because of the volcanic eruption in Iceland, our airline cancelled our flights and we had no choice in the matter. The Paddington refused to refund our payment. They did not even offer a credit for future stay -- absolutely inflexible. This is all the more upsetting because, with the Paddington's location on a direct tube route from Heathrow, you know they will be able to re-book the room very easily right now, with no monetary loss to them. I have asked American Express to attempt to get our money back. I agree that Paddington's website says 'no refunds' but at time of booking one does not expect to be cancelled due to volcanic eruption!

Reviews.Title: “If you get a bargain price, it is value for money”
Reviews.Author: smartnik
Reviews.Content: It would appear that the authors of negative reviews paid a lot for this hotel and expected just the same from it, but it did not deliver. Well, I have to admit that we booked it three months in advance and were tempted by their special offer. I hate to confess it that but it cost us just 86 pounds per double room for the entire week-end. Can it be any cheaper in London's Zone 1? Having said that, I maintain that the hotel's value-for-money ratio is excellent. Location-wise, it is perfect. It is close both to Paddington and the Lancaster Gate station on the Central Line (convenient from Liverpool St station). Five minutes to the Hyde Park, ten minutes to the Marble Arch and Oxford St. Can you ask for more? True, the reception is located in the building on the opposite site of the street. Is that really so much of an inconvenience? The hotel is a Victorian mansion: tall floors, high ceilings, just nineteen rooms in total. But: compared to very many hotels in London and Paris, rooms are of a decent size. I am saying this with a degree of confidence because on our way out we peeked into all other rooms on our floor as they were being cleaned and the doors were left ajar. There is plenty of space for luggage and walking around the room. Admittedly, the furniture is extremely basic and worn out, often chipped. It is, however, clean and in good working condition: the closet doors open and close, the bed is taut and not caved in, the fridge is functioning. The bathroom is tiled floor to ceiling which obviously helps them to maintain it clean. The carpet has seen better days and, yes, is stained but nothing grossly indecent, either. Breakfast was nothing to write home about: a basic selection of cornflakes in a box, skimmed milk, apple and orange juice, toast bread, jam and butter. No eggs, no sausage, no meat. In sum, for the money we paid, I would definitely recommend this hotel. However, if you have to pay more than, say, 60 or 70 pounds per double room per night, you will probably be more comfortable elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Paddington hotel- clean, comfortable and cheap”
Reviews.Author: fairy1984
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel for my birthday, the day before we went i logged on here and read the reviews...needless to say I panicked that I was going to be staying in some dark and dingy hotel that wasn't cleaned properly and the room wasn't big enough to swing a cat...he told me not to worry, to see and experience it for myself and I'm very glad I did, here's my experience: The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Paddington Station and is located on a beautiful street of old terraced properties 2 seconds walk from hyde park and Lancaster Gate tube station. We got to the hotel at 12, there was a sign on the front door explaining that the check in was across the street in the royal court apartments, this really isn't a problem. The staff were friendly and pleasant and took our luggage from us and stored it (you can't check in until 2). We came back later on and the porter promptly got our luggage and we went to our room. The staff insist that you drop off your key to them when you go out and collect when you return- again no fuss here, the reception is open 24hrs and if you're anything like me i'd much rather them look after it than risk loosing it! On entering the Paddington it smelt clean and the imposing victorian building is lovely...yes there is no lift but the stairs really aren't an issue (its not like you're going mountaineering). We got into our room and were pleasantly suprised, it wasn't huge but there was enough space for us not to be in each others faces (lets put it this way i've stayed in chain hotels that have smaller rooms) Bed was comfy, we had tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, wardrobe and 2 bed side tables. Bathroom was clean, a similar size to my wardrobe- but no problem, it was small but functional and lets face it how long are you REALLY going to spend in there?? Would recommend you take your own toilettries though. Breakfast was fine, cereal, croissants, jam, bread, boiled eggs tea coffee juice etc. Staff were pleasant and quickly cleared plates after guests had left. So I guess the big question would I stay again? ABSOLUTELY!!! £50 a night to stay in one of London's most beautiful locations...this is a bargain and I think it's one of London's hidden Gems. The bottom line here is don't believe everything you read, go and try it out for yourself. If you want the sort of standards that in central London will cost you £100+ a night then don't book somewhere that costs half the price. But if you want somewhere cheerful, convenient and cheap enough so you can afford to enjoy the rest of what London has to offer then book the Paddington. :-)

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY.”
Reviews.Author: JolieCrush
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend anyone in their right mind stay at this hotel - period. Even though it is conveniently located by the tube and the park - 5-8 minute walk, the hotel is going through some major renovation in the hotels. They are not renovating the rooms. My friends and I stayed here for two nights, we wanted to cancel our reservation entirely but they wouldn't allow it. They would charge us for 1 night stay if you cancel the reservation. If you stay for that 1 night, they'll charge you two night - twisted sales positioning. We were so frustrated, we stayed the required 2 nights and canceled the third night and made a completely new reservation somewhere else. The hotel room was disgusting, we had a kitchen in our room. The room was dirty and looked like roaches probably infested this place. The hotel staff was not too welcoming either. They were willing to move us to a bigger room if we paid some ridiculous rate, so we asked to see it first. We were all very horrified at their upgraded room. It was no better than the room we had. Save yourself the money, time and worrying about whether or not this hotel room will turn out okay and book somewhere else. I wouldn't stay here again - so i wouldn't recommend this to anyone unless they clean up their act - staff & room quality.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CAUTION!”
Reviews.Author: Bud101
Reviews.Content: I am aware of "on the cheap," but The Paddington Hotel was close to being just plain BAD. When we first got to our room we noticed immediately there was NOT a chair in the room. The windows were filthy. The top of the closet on which we placed our emptied luggage was filthy. The television was ify. TWO days we did NOT get complete room service. I finally placed the coffee serrvice in the middle of the bed, dirty cups, no coffee .... had just been ignored. AS well, we were "given" two plastic cups for water. After the two were used and disgarded, no others ever appeared. As well as the coffee service I placed the "sort of" soap dish from the bathroom with NO soaps replacing the ones used. The breakfast was sort of adequate. The hotel staff across the street were nice and did what they could ("the cleaning staff has left for the day"). They even sent a porter with ONE folding chair. At least ONE and at least a CHAIR, rather than the worn out bean bag whatever that was so low to the ground a 68 year old person (as I am) could not even get down to. JUST PLAIN and SIMPLY a TERRIBLE HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful AND it stinks!”
Reviews.Author: DalissMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful, the room was so small that you could only open 1 suitcase on the floor at a time. It was the tiniest hotel room I have ever seen (despite extensive travel throughout both Europe and UK). Carpet is very old and stained I refused to walk on it barefoot, luckily I had packed slippers. Bathroom is clearly a converted wardrobe, so that gives you an idea of small it is. Bathroom is so old and awful I couldn't bring myself to even have a shower. Worst of all.. the hotel ABSOLUTELY STINKS! As soon as you walk through the door into the hallway/stairway the smell hits you like a ton of bricks and is even stronger once you enter your room. The smell is best described as day old greasy KFC chicken so unless you like the smell of fried chicken, DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL. As for breakfast, at first the spread looked plentiful and varied but on closer inspection, the bread for toast had specks of mould all over it. I don't care that we were only paying 39 pounds per night (it was mid January) this is completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: itravel82376
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paddington Hotel on two different nights a week apart as stopovers. It is very close to Paddington Tube station, a 10 minute walk. The check-in is across the street in another hotel, a little inconvenient given that the front desk wants to hold your room key when you go out for the day. Despite that, reception is very friendly and helpful. The Paddington Hotel does not have an elevator, so be ready to walk a few flights up the circular staircase to your room. The room itself is standard, nice decor, tv, bathroom with shower -- all clean. There is also coffee and tea making facilities with creamers/milk in the mini fridge. The room we stayed in on the first night was nicer than the room we stayed in on the second night -- not sure how that works but we were only there the night, wasn't going to complain. The room rate includes continental breakfast, which is located in the basement of the hotel. I wasn't really impressed with the breakfast options -- fruit, cereal boxes, sliced wonder bread, croissants, boiled eggs, spreadable cheese, instant coffee and tea. Had I known earlier, I would have skipped that breakfast and went down the street to 'Raffles' diner -- awesome, cheap breakfast with real coffee. This hotel was in a good part of town, close to the tube station in the city centre and reasonably priced -- I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Stevo_The_Devo
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews which I consider unfair regarding The Paddington. Remember this is London and accomodation is expensive, especially when this close to the centre of town. The Paddington is close to the Heathrow Express and London's joys are a relaxing walk through Hyde Park away. I consider it great value and would book again. If you want a huge bathroom and fancy facilities, either increase your budget or look further out of town. If you'd rather spend your money on things other than a place to rest your head, book at The Paddington. I spent my savings on a deluxe dinner at Gordon Ramsay's ;-) Steve Barbuto Perth, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Paws33
Reviews.Content: Hello, The Paddington Hotel is well located in a nice zone with lots of public transportation. The problems were as follows: this Hotel doesn’t have an elevator (some rooms are in the 5th floor), it has carpet all over the floor, they do not gave us enough towels, the reception is across the street and they only gave us one key which we had to share, the breakfast is very poor – you can eat better and cheap near the subway station, it’s hot, the rooms have a lot of noise from the street, and some rooms are too small… Well, for what they charge we found better while we were there. Better luck to you all!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: joyceyd
Reviews.Content: disgusting.have booked loads of hotels over the years for myself and for family members and this is the first time i was embarrassed by a hotel i chose.was my sisters 40th so sent her and husband to london and boy were they traumatised.photos do not show filth and dirt that was hotel.all websites should take this hotel off of their books.disgusted

Reviews.Title: “Good Cheap Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Doodleit
Reviews.Content: This is a good cheap hotel in central London close to Kensington Gardens and Paddington tube station. Small cheap rooms, good hot showers, refrigerator, and coffee machine in room. We had a tiny room the first night we were there on the top floor, but asked to move to a bigger room that was next door and was much happer with the size and lay out. I've stayed at this hotel before in 2005 and it's a safe and clean place to stay in London. Breakfast is served in the basement and I was fully satisfied with it (coffee,juice, milk, cereal, toast, jam, and boiled eggs).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible horrible place”
Reviews.Author: brenandsarah
Reviews.Content: We are just back in Dublin after spending 3 nights in the Paddington ( Hotel). It is a dirty, shabby place. No lift so flights of stairs are a must. Old damaged venetian blinds, old wooden windows that rattle loudly in the wind, Tv with only poor reception and a couple of channels, dirty old carpet probably hoovered but awful marks from shoes, badly needs to be replaced, all wood work chipped and damaged and shabby looking. We found a condom wrapper under the bed. Squeeky floorboards every footstep. Dining room an absolute disgrace. Down in a basement,darh and no windows, it is like a kichen in a community hall. Dreadful choice of cereal and toast and 3 Foreign women serving just hoping you dont stay for food to give them more work to do. On our second night we returned to our room and there was an overwhelming smell of sewerage coming from our bathroom. The very unfriendly porter eventually came up and, in all fairness did not hesitate to put us into another room. The fact that they had a room available on a Saturday night in central London tells you something. £60 a night we were charged and despite the relatively low cost it was not value for money. Do not go to this hotel unless you are really desperate.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: rmenende
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by internet. Prices were good and the photos I show were nice. I was a bit worried when I read that reception was in another hotel. When we arrived there, we found an old and dirty house (not really an hotel, the hotel was across the street), no elevator, the carpet dirty and worn out, the furniture and appliances (very scarce) from IKEA, the lights very soft (maybe to avoid you seeing the scraps). I do not know who took the pictures that appear in the web site, but if I were a lawyer, I should sue them! And what to tell about the breakfast! the worst hotel breakfast I had in my live! The first to arrive got the croissant! But quite close from the tube and train station, that's true!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: FelixFosters
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from lastminute.com for an overnight stay following on from the Concert for Diana. Stayed in room 10, the room itself was adequate. Did not get a very good reception off the small TV which was placed on top of the fridge. The bathroom was so small could just about get in and out just! The main door had a gap with light coming through so had to put a towel in front of it to get to sleep. On the plus side the rates were good for London and the bed was very comfortable. The tube is only a short walk away. The lemon sherbuts on the reception counter were great! The breakfast is more than adequate given the rate for the room. A good selection of crossaints, white and brown bread for toast with preserves. Juices and tea/coffee plus a selection of cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Great If On Budget”
Reviews.Author: liams_mod
Reviews.Content: Me and my freind stayed here for one night while we went shopping and for a night out, the hotel room was good (what you'd expect for the money) The reception staff were very helpfull and gave us handfulls of sweets when we arrived :-) We didn't mind being across the road but although we were only on the first floor i feel sorry for the people who stayed at the top of the spiral staircase!! Maybe the only thing i would suggest would be a bell boy type service?? Overall this hotel was good for a nights stay. afterall you're only sleeping there...

Reviews.Title: “ok for price”
Reviews.Author: liali4
Reviews.Content: POSITIVE the room was spacious, furniture ok, clean, the bathroom was a little bit small, nice area NEGATIVE the breakfast is terrible however AFTER ALL it is near the metro so it was very convenient for us, we just slept and took a shower so it was ok for that purpose:)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay! You Will Regret It.”
Reviews.Author: pottsyap
Reviews.Content: My Girl friend booked this as a surprise whilst going to see a concert in the capital, and boy oh boy what a surprise it was! Arrived as previous reviews said at the hotel we viewed on the website where a notice on the door stated to book in at the'sister' hotel across the road. Long story short, that hotel we looked at was booked up so we were offered a room at the 'sister' hotel. Got to the room and could smell sewage. Complained along with two other couples at reception and offered another room. Wish I hadn't complained. That room was the ........pits! We slept on top of the stinking bed sheet fully clothed, where during the early hours was woken to the rustling in the corner of the room, where a rat was tucking into the biscuits in the carrier bag. We immediately demanded our money back, but were offered a place to stay at the original hotel booked. Thinking that would solve it, we arrived to a room that looked like they had tried to smarten up contempory style but I dont think 'stains' on the top sheets and cushions would impress Miss Beany. I advice anyone considering, DO NOY STAY! It really was and is the worst hotel, room we have ever stayed. A & L . from Wales.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Juniper_ie
Reviews.Content: I was wary of staying in this hotel based on past reviews posted here, but I have to say, in terms of value for money, The Paddington Hotel was fine. The location of the hotel is excellent and our bedroom, although small, included a television, fridge, tea/coffee making facilities, and hair dryer. The bathroom was also small, but the shower was good. The decor is trying to be "boutique hotel" standard, but it does look a bit shabby - scuff marks on the wall, etc. So if you're looking for an okay hotel in a great location and your expectations aren't too high, then you won't go too far wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jlem12
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on this hotel, so I wasn't expecting too much. I was pleasently surprised. I was even able to check in at 9:30am - a great bonus after a seven hour flight! The room was clean and comfortable. I was most impressed with the staff, who went out of their way to be helpful. Compared with other comparable London hotels I've stayed at, this was the best. I will definately return on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bacardo_queen
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the other reviews for this hotel and I have to say, there are some things I agree with and others I don't. On a positive note, the rooms we had was more than adequate for our purposes. It was nicely decorated, furnished with a double bed, a settee, wardrobe, fridge and even a microwave! The shower was powerful and bathroom was clean. We were only stopping the night for a friend's wedding in the area so weren't at the hotel too long but we were pleasantly suprised with the hotel for the price we paid. We booked through venere.com and got a promotional price of £55 for the night which for the area was very good value for money. I know that the normnal rate is higher than this and I think I wouldn't be as happy if I'd paid this instead. I do agree that it's very convenient having to check in in the hotel across the road but it is literally just across the road and for one night this didn't bother us. Also I would agree that the staff are not friendly at all but again, this didn't really bother us only being there a night. Breakfast was quite comical, going downstairs where you a have choice of toast or cereal and if you want eggs there's little foreign (i say foreign as I'm not very good with nationalities!) lady who'll boil or poach them for you in the tiniest kithen you'll ever see that has a hatch into the dining area. Not the best breakfast in the worold for for £55 a room, who can complain! Overall I was very satisfied with my stay and would probably book again if I needed somewhere in the area.

HotelInfo.Name: The Paddington Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 28 Gloucester Terrace, London W2 3DH, England
